Project Description
This project includes a whitepaper, code samples and a short webcast series to help Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) developers work with WCF services. Topics: proxies, shared libraries, exception handling, concurrency, multithreading, hosting services, and REST-based.



The latest release of the whitepaper and related code samples an be found here: Whitepaper and Sample Code

The following series of mini webcasts support the whitepaper. Some of the mini webcasts are introductory for those WPF developers new to WCF. Others focus on specific considerations and illustrates some of the points made in the whitepaper with useful demonstrations.
  • Mini Webcast #1: WCF Services 101
    • If you are new to WCF, this provides you with a crash course in creating and hosting WCF services
  • Mini Webcast #2: Proxy Generation for WPF Developers
    • Get some tips on proxy generation with Add Service Reference related to data binding, change notification and version tolerance.
  • Mini Webcast #3: Comparing Proxy Generation and Shared Libraries
    • Compare the WCF client developer experience when using generated proxies or sharing metadata libraries.
  • Mini Webcast #4: Proxy Lifetime Management
    • Get tips on proxy lifetime management, exception handling scenarios, and safe proxy disposal.
  • Mini Webcast #5: Proxies and Excepton Handling
    • Learn how to use a custom exception handling WCF proxy to encapsulate lifetime management, exception handling for faulted channels and session timeouts, and proper disposal.
  • Check out the custom tool that automates generating the exception handling proxy!!! Exception Handling WCF Proxy Generator
  • Mini Webcast #6: Hosting Services in WPF Clients
    • Learn about hosting WCF services in WPF clients, and see a custom Visual Studio template that sets you up with an instant sample.
    • Download the WPF ServiceHost Application Template
    • Mini Webcast #7: Creating a WPF Pub-Sub Scenario
      • Learn how to use a custom Visual Studio template that sets you up with an instant publish and subscribe sample where the subscriber services is hosted by a WPF client.
      • Download the WPF Publish and Subscribe Application Template
